Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n5qhdmlV6p1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ZgAn3YHPu-g" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Nassault is back with what may be his best-looking, most inspiring KSP cinematic to date.</p>
He's got a Vimeo link in the description for anyone who can't watch it on YouTube.
Wow, my kin went down to the floor watching this. Thank you so much for this Nassault.

Yeah Nassault is quite awesome. Pale Blue Dot is still my favorite one of his, though.

He's got a Vimeo link in the description for anyone who can't watch it on YouTube.

Why can some people not watch it on YouTube? Country regulations?
They report they are getting a copyright message of some sort.
I'm sure Carl Sagan would be proud of what Nassault did and would definitely allow him to use his speech if he were still alive today. It's too bad they're blocking it from copyright.

Nice, though it has too much crossover to be 'just' a KSP - 'Kerbal Space Program movie'. This is much bigger, this is about HSP:

'Human Socio-economic Priorities'.

Also: ISA Map sat @3:38... Shouldn't that be SCAN Sat? Unless Nassault knows something about ISA I don't.
Very beautiful! I like the crossovers, it suggests a bigger universe.

I'm sure Carl Sagan would be proud of what Nassault did and would definitely allow him to use his speech if he were still alive today. It's too bad they're blocking it from copyright.

Gladly it's not the Pale Blue Dot quote that's the problem, it's the soundtrack he used from the movie "Gone baby Gone". I have the same problem with my latest Battlefield cinematic; I'd imagine Germany is the primary country on the blocked list as they tend to be pretty strict on music copyright :/

I'm sure Carl Sagan would be proud of what Nassault did and would definitely allow him to use his speech if he were still alive today.

I wouldn't be so sure. Do the letters "BHA" mean anything to you?

http://www.tuaw.com/2014/02/26/when-carl-sagan-sued-apple-twice/

.

In the case in question Sagan objected to his name being used for commercial purposes - something completely different?

The core message of the video is one that Carl Sagan expressed, promoted and promulgated repeatedly. I can only imagine he would have been pleased (if he could have seen this) that the message has not been forgotten!

I suppose Sagan would likely have been pleased in this case...but one can't be completely certain.

Anyhow, as a guy who used Macs from System 4 through Mac OS 9, I certainly couldn't resist the opportunity to reminisce about Apple and Sagan butting heads in the '90s.
